modules.description: Converts string representations to a custom type, with options for safe, optional, or exception-based parsing. Provides conversion to integer types for numerical processing. Used to validate and transform network interface identifiers from textual input.

Provides operations to create and manipulate socket endpoints with specific domain and type configurations, including Unix, IPv4, and IPv6 domains, and stream, datagram, raw, and sequenced packet types. Works with custom types representing socket domains and message transmission modes. Used to establish network communication channels, such as TCP streams or UDP datagrams, by specifying protocol families and socket types.

Converts between socket address representations, including Unix, IPv4, and IPv6 addresses with port numbers. Handles serialization and deserialization of addresses into and from byte buffers using Cstruct. Constructs addresses from IP addresses and ports, and converts to Unix socket address structures.

Provides socket options for configuring IPv4 and IPv6 multicast settings, including interface selection, time-to-live, loopback, and group membership. Works with socket address types, interface identifiers, and boolean or integer values. Used to set options like joining a multicast group, adjusting hop limits, or enabling IPv6-only mode on sockets.

Provides functions to join and leave IPv6 multicast groups, manage multicast interface indices, and set loopback options. Operates on socket file descriptors, IPv6 addresses, and interface identifiers. Used to configure network applications for efficient multicast traffic reception on IPv6 networks.

Encapsulates IPv6 multicast capabilities by handling address conversion, socket configuration, and option setting. It manages custom types for interface identifiers, socket domains, and address structures, enabling operations like parsing strings to numeric forms, creating socket endpoints, and serializing addresses. It supports tasks such as joining multicast groups, setting time-to-live values, and constructing IPv6 socket addresses from IP and port inputs. The module facilitates low-level network communication by bridging textual representations with binary data and socket configurations.
